[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Personnel Management System (PMS) defines requirements for managing personnel in regional departments and local agencies.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with HR databases, payroll systems, and regional agency records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS allows HR personnel and regional managers to manage employee and agency details.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PMS supports workstations, tablets, and secure authentication devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and OAuth 2.0 for security.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS secures data via TLS encryption and role-based access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS is optimized for large-scale personnel tracking and regional data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS manages employees, agencies, and assignments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS is configurable for regional departments and agencies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS connects with payroll, employee benefits, performance evaluation, and reporting tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS supports personnel tracking, regional management, and agency structuring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS manages personnel records, agencies, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS is designed for HR personnel, regional managers, and administrative staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS relies on an up-to-date employee database and properly assigned regional managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PMS requires updated personnel data and active agency connections.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Personnel: Employees working in local agencies or regional departments.
Regional Management: Regional departments managing agencies.
Local Agency: Company branch per region.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall store and manage personnel records for local agencies (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track regional departments and their managed agencies (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process personnel updates in under 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow registration and modification of personnel details (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall manage assignments of employees to local agencies and regional departments (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate reports on personnel distribution across agencies (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface for managing personnel and agencies.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store personnel details, including role and agency.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store regional department codes, labels, and linked local agencies.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store personnel performance data.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce unique identification for employees, agencies, and regional departments.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with HR data security and regional employment regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log personnel updates and assignments.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests personnel management, agency tracking, and reporting functionalities.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and HR policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Employment regulations, personnel tracking standards, and company HR policies.
